segments.text: I can't believe the woman doesn't notice the sink overflowing right next to her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, creating a huge puddle on the floor, and she's standing in it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the children behind her, quietly taking cookies from the jar, and I wonder how she can be so oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on a stool that looks like it's about to tip over any second, and I feel a sense of urgency to warn her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is standing nearby, waiting for her share of the cookies, and it's like they're in their own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the garden outside the window, so peaceful and well-maintained, a stark contrast to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The scene is so chaotic, yet the woman seems so calm and focused on her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long the sink has been overflowing, and how much water has already spilled out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman must be really tired, to not notice all this commotion.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she turns around soon, before any accidents happen, and takes a break from her tasks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The scene is so ordinary, yet so extraordinary in its details, and I feel a sense of concern for everyone's safety.
segments.speaker: PAR
